insecure_pc_original.long_description: Proportion of households facing food insecurity, based on a financial model considering income category and household size. The food security status is determined after comparing household income versus cost-of-living. Cost of living includes eight categories, including food, housing, healthcare, childcare, transportation, taxes, internet, and other expenses.
insecure_pc_original.long_name: Estimated percentage of total households facing food insecurity
insecure_pc_original.short_description: Proportion of households facing food insecurity, based on a financial model considering income category and household size.
insecure_pc_original.short_name: Food Insecure Households Percent (Unsubsidized, UVA alpha ver.)

sources.name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
Department   of Labor Women’s Bureau National
National   Bureau of Economic Research’s program TAXSIM Version 35

insecure_pc_snap.long_description: Proportion of households facing food insecurity after receiving an estimated amount of SNAP benefits, considering income category and household size. The food security status is determined after comparing household income versus cost-of-living. Cost of living includes eight categories, including food, housing, healthcare, childcare, transportation, taxes, internet, and other expenses.
insecure_pc_snap.long_name: Estimated proportion of total households facing food insecurity
insecure_pc_snap.short_description: Proportion of households facing food insecurity after receiving an estimated amount of SNAP benefits considering income category and household size.
insecure_pc_snap.short_name: Food Insecure Households Percent including SNAP (UVA alpha ver.)

sources.name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
Department   of Labor Women’s Bureau National
National   Bureau of Economic Research’s program TAXSIM Version 35

insecure_pc_snap_covid.long_description: Proportion of households facing food insecurity after receiving an estimated amount of extended SNAP benefits that activated during the Covid-19 emergency, considering income category and household size. The food security status is determined after comparing household income versus cost-of-living. Cost of living includes eight categories, including food, housing, healthcare, childcare, transportation, taxes, internet, and other expenses.
insecure_pc_snap_covid.long_name: Estimated proportion of total households facing food insecurity with extended SNAP benefits
insecure_pc_snap_covid.short_description: Proportion of households facing food insecurity after receiving an estimated amount of extended SNAP benefits that activated during the Covid-19 emergency considering income category and household size.
insecure_pc_snap_covid.short_name: Food Insecure Households Percent including SNAP max benefits (UVA alpha ver.)

sources.name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
Department   of Labor Women’s Bureau National
National   Bureau of Economic Research’s program TAXSIM Version 35

at_risk_pc_original.long_description: Proportion of households at-risk of facing food insecurity, based on a financial model considering income category and household size. The food security status is determined after comparing household income versus cost-of-living. Cost of living includes eight categories, including food, housing, healthcare, childcare, transportation, taxes, internet, and other expenses.
at_risk_pc_original.long_name: Estimated proportion of total households at-risk of facing food insecurity
at_risk_pc_original.short_description: Proportion of households at-risk of facing food insecurity, based on a financial model considering income category and household size.
at_risk_pc_original.short_name: Food Insecure 'At Risk' Households Percent (Unsubsidized, UVA alpha ver.)

National   Bureau of Economic Research’s program TAXSIM Version 35
